page.title: 17Landscape
page.content: Our area is a Rural area South of Swindon. The only settlement is the large village of Wroughton which is separated from Swindon by the M4 motorway. Farming mainly covers the East/West Clay Vale which lies North of the Marlborough Downs. To the South of Wroughton the scarp slope rises very steeply and is mainly rough pasture. Wroughton Parish Church is built on a good vantage point overlooking the village. The majority of the Clay Vale in the area is used for dairy farming with a little mixed farming so the landscape is covered by a pattern of smallish fields. The South Eastern part of the area is covered by Wroughton which has extended quite a way Westwards over the Vale in the past few years.
